page.title: 02Cleeve Lock
page.content: The present Cleeve lock is nine years old. It has been repaired lots of times.One man works there but in the summer there are two because more people go boating during the summer .The Thames Water Authority own the lock.The lock keeper starts work at 9.00am.Weirs are used to keep the water deep enough for boats.The lock keeper has worked at the lock for eleven years.The water through the lock is flowing south.500to600 boats go through the lock in a day in summer.100 go through other days.Once, in a day, the lock keeper opened and closed the lock gates 100 times.
